channel.title: V10 Beta is ready! ğŸ“¦
channel.description:
We just released the beta version of the V10 release :100: . This contains many quality-of-life tweaks to the front-end (vertical navbar, session expiry won't lose a user's place in the app), improved visualisations (fixed table visualisation header, horizontal bar charts) and stability upgrades (typescript, Antd v4). For a full list of changes, we encourage you to checkout the [CHANGELOG](https://github.com/getredash/redash/blob/release/10.0.x/CHANGELOG.md).
As always this release wouldnâ€™t be possible without the help of our community. This version had contributions from over 35 people :pray:
Our special thanks to [Sohail Ahmed](https://pk.linkedin.com/in/sohail-ahmed-755776184) for disclosing a vulnerability in our "forgot password" page which we patched in #5425.
### Upgrading
(This section is duplicated from the previous release - since many users will upgrade directly from V8 -> V10)
Typically, if you are running your own instance of Redash and wish to upgrade, you would simply modify the Docker tag in your `docker-compose.yml` file. Since RQ has replaced Celery in this version, there are a couple extra modifications that need to be done in your `docker-compose.yml` :
1. Under `services/scheduler/environment` , omit `QUEUES` and `WORKERS_COUNT` (and omit `environment` altogether if it is empty). 2. Under `services` , add a new service for general RQ jobs:
worker: <<: *redash-service command: worker environment: QUEUES: "periodic emails default" WORKERS_COUNT: 1
Following that, force a recreation of your containers with `docker-compose up --force-recreate --build` and you should be good to go.
### Gameplan
We plan for only a brief public beta so we can push new cloud images, documentation, and a setup script by the end of summer. We've been testing these changes internally for several months and the beta is quite stable. Thanks for your patience as this has been an off-kilter release cycle. We look forward to pushing a final release out ASAP.

item.title: V10 Beta is ready! ğŸ“¦
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
I added a top-level post to track the effort on distributing new cloud images for V10 as well as our forthcoming documentation updates.

V10 Follow-up items Development
Hey all, tl;dr V10 is ready to use. Docs + new cloud images are forthcoming. Follow this thread for status updates. As you may know, we cut the V10 release after a lengthy beta a couple weeks ago. Itâ€™s public on dockerhub and our github releases page and itâ€™s quite stable. But we didnâ€™t make a top-level forum post with a box emoji yet because there are a few follow-up items to wrap beforehand: Documentation updates for V10 There were a lot of small changes in V10 that should appear in the â€¦

item.title: V10 Beta is ready! ğŸ“¦
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
For anyone watching this thread, the tag for the final release of Redash V10 is now live on our docker hub. The tag is redash:10.0.0.b50363. Iâ€™ll put up the formal announcement tomorrow and begin making the new cloud images, doc updates, and finalise our migration script for V10.

Our release page on github has now been updated for V10: Releases Â· getredash/redash Â· GitHub
